p: In order to explain if antitumor activity of this oil could depend on pro-oxidant activity, as in the case of other natural compounds, we performed a separate experiment in which cell lines were treated with the antioxidant N-acetyl-L-cysteine (NAC) at two concentrations, 1 mM and 2 mM before exposure to the essential oil at the corresponding IC 50 values as reported in Tables 2 and 3. In all tested cell lines a reduction between 27.3% and 38.0% of the cytotoxicity activity of the essential oil was observed, suggesting that the mechanism involves an at least partially pro-oxidant effect ( Table 3).
